Text: Saint John, New Brunswick:  The Saint John metropolitan area covers a land area of 3,362.95 sqkm across the Caledonia Highlands, with a population (as of 2016) of 126,202.

Text: Saint John, New Brunswick:  After the partitioning of the colony of Nova Scotia in 1784, the new colony of New Brunswick was thought to be named 'New Ireland' with the capital to be in Saint John before being vetoed by Britain's King George III.
